pullRequest.title: Sanitize Hyperlink String Decorator links
pullRequest.bodyText:
Overview
This PR fixes an issue with Hyperlink String Field Decorators. When a non-link string is included in the message field for a Hyperlink Decorator field, the link is still clickable in stream-specific message tables on the Graylog Search page.
Now, the link is only clickable if the field contains a valid url starting with the protocol scheme http:// or https://.
This change adds the commons-validator Java dependency. This allows effective URL validation without the need for reinventing custom regex patters for handle all cases.
Testing
Verify that Hyperlink String decorated fields only render a clickable link for real URLs that start with http:// or https:// and also that other non-link string are still displayed, but are not clickable.

commit.message:
Sanitize decorator links

When the decorator link includes any text that does not begin with `http` or `https` and a valid link that follows, the UI will only render the text and not the link.
